dataList.name: Bizarre Machine
dataList.desc:
There's a bizarre-looking machine. In front of it is a coin.

Then there's a twinkling, glowing coin slot on the machine—it's almost enticing us to deposit the coin inside it.

A disembodied, mechanical voice echoes from somewhere when we walk up to the machine.

"Test your luck!"

Where did that vocalization come from? Did it come from within the machine, or was it this space itself whispering to me?

I barely catch myself after absentmindedly picking up the coin and walking up to the machine's coin slot. I should think this through.

result:
On closer examination, this coin could come in useful in the dungeon.

... We should quit while we're ahead, even for a small gain. Much better than gambling this coin away into that suspicious machine for some unknown, mysterious outcome we have no way of gauging.

We pocket the coin and leave the machine.

options.message: Insert the coin in the slot.
result:
The slot sucks the coin inside with a clack.

“#%^*@%@!!#@$%”

The machine makes a strange, ineffable and unsettling noise. After a moment, it spits out something from its... vent-like apparatus.

It zooms off to somewhere before we even get a chance to realize what happened.

The slot sucks the coin inside with a clack.

"……"

Then nothing.

"Aw, darnit! It ate the coin!"

One of the Sinners stomps forward to beat up the machine, but it zooms off to somewhere before we even get a chance to see what would happen.

dataList.name: Carnival of La Manchaland
dataList.desc:
"In this endlessly... this eternally... blessed carnival..."

The parade brings happy exclamations and smiles to the spectators. It's gaudy and extravagant no matter where or how we look at it.

It's just like the lyrics... it feels as though the carnival really is eternally blessed to go on forever.

"Oh."

Someone lets out a brief cry of pain, and a rusty syringe clatters to the ground.

"B-blood! Blood!"
"J-just a drop, please...!"

The parade falls apart immediately as everyone rushes madly toward the syringe.
It's like they don't even realize who or what's around them; they seem just about ready to rip apart whatever that stands in their way.

Should we stop them?

options.messageDesc: Lust & Sloth Advantage check. Pass to gain a Bleed E.G.O Gift.

dataList.name: The Carousel
dataList.desc:
Is that... a carousel?

There's an incandescent, almost blindingly bright structure radiating brightly in this dark space.

“…….”

"Oh my, something wrong?"

"Hm? N-nay, 'tis naught to worry."

The carousel seems to be occupying some Sinners' minds.

Should we stop by?

options.messageDesc: Lust & Sloth Advantage check. Pass to gain a Keywordless E.G.O Gift.

dataList.name: Refracted Sleeping Bag of a Bygone Day
dataList.desc:
Something is breathing heavily. The source of it, its form strange, lies there.

It appears to be an Abnormality. The thing is struggling to even breathe—its every breath is laborious and irregular.

Is it... crying?

options.messageDesc: Run a Pride & Envy Advantage check. Pass to gain a Poise E.G.O Gift.

result:
Listening to the pained breathing is heartrending.

The sheer sensation was so overwhelming that it was making me nauseous. The Sinners weren't doing much better, either; they were either grabbing their heads or were slowly getting drenched in cold sweat.

"P-plug your ears. I think this... this sound's driving me insane."

I tell the rest of the Sinners to follow suit, and we slowly start to feel better.

... The Abnormality continued to make that noise for a while, before falling completely silent.

dataList.name: Refracted Four-hundred Roses
dataList.desc:
The bloodsteeped petals are so crimson that one might almost mistake it to be bleeding.

Its stems, siphoning blood from somewhere to feed the petals, are twisted, dark, and red.

Vicious and sharp thorns riddle its skin.

But curiosity takes hold—perhaps breaking off a thorn might cause it to bleed?

options.messageDesc: Lust & Envy Advantage check. Pass to gain a Bleed E.G.O Gift.

result:
Curiosity is the usual suspect when it comes to dead cats.

Let's not provoke it unnecessarily this time.
